definitions.definition: the nonphysical part of a person that is the seat of emotions and character; the soul.
examples: we seek a harmony between body and spirit
synonyms: id; pneuma "harmony between body and spirit"

definitions.definition: the nonphysical part of a person regarded as a person's true self and as capable of surviving physical death or separation.
examples: a year after he left, his spirit is still present

definitions.definition: the nonphysical part of a person manifested as an apparition after their death; a ghost.
examples: ghost, presence; spook a spirit haunts the island

definitions.definition: a highly refined substance or fluid thought to govern vital phenomena.
those qualities regarded as forming the definitive or typical elements in the character of a person, nation, or group or in the thought and attitudes of a particular period.
examples: the university is a symbol of the nation's egalitarian spirit

definitions.definition: a person identified with their most prominent mental or moral characteristics or with their role in a group or movement.
examples: he was a leading spirit in the conference

definitions.definition: a specified emotion or mood, especially one prevailing at a particular time.
examples: I hope the team will build on this spirit of confidence
the warm weather lifted everyone's spirits after the winter
synonyms: temper "she was in good spirits when I left"

definitions.definition: the quality of courage, energy, and determination or assertiveness.
examples: his visitors admired his spirit and good temper
synonyms: passion; informalget-up-and-go "they played with great spirit"

definitions.definition: the attitude or intentions with which someone undertakes or regards something.
examples: he confessed in a spirit of self-respect, not defiance

definitions.definition: the real meaning or the intention behind something as opposed to its strict verbal interpretation.
examples: the rule had been broken in spirit if not in letter

definitions.definition: strong distilled liquor such as brandy, whiskey, gin, or rum.
examples: strong liquor/drink; Moreinformalhard stuff, firewater, hooch "he drinks spirits"Morehard stuff, firewater, hooch he drinks spirits

definitions.definition: a volatile liquid, especially a fuel, prepared by distillation.
a solution of volatile components extracted from something, typically by distillation or by solution in alcohol.

examples: stolen cows were spirited away some distance to prevent detection
